document_name_accent: nhoi mau co tim khong st chenh len.json
document_title: Non-ST elevation myocardial infarction: Causes and symptoms
subsection_content:
Non-ST elevation myocardial infarction is a type of myocardial infarction, which causes a heart attack. Compared with ST-elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI), heart damage caused by non-ST-elevation myocardial infarction also causes serious damage but shows fewer symptoms and on the electrocardiogram, so it is more difficult to detect. . (first)
Heart attacks can be fatal and cause long-term damage to organs in the body, increasing the risk of further heart problems. Therefore, when having a myocardial infarction, the patient needs immediate medical attention.

Heart attacks can be fatal and cause long-term damage to organs in the body, increasing the risk of further heart problems. Therefore, when having a myocardial infarction, the patient needs immediate medical attention.
